Reviews.Title: “Niceee...”
Reviews.Author: Juha V
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the beginning of March 2012. Hotel is really well located in the edge of downtown. Taxis are easily available in front of the hotel.(Best way to travel in different locations around Dubai, also really cheap) Hotel itself is little bit old style ,but that didn't matter at all. Our room was cosy and we had a nice view towards the Dubai centrum skyline. Pool area was clean and it was well equipped. I went few times also in the gym, training machines were good. Hotel has few own restaurants and also three individually operating restaurants. ( Mexican,Indian and "steak house") Overall service in Rydges Plaza is great and helpfull. They also arrange transportations to the Jumeira beach park few times a day. If you think the price rate / location/ and services. Rydges Plaza is a good option .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mintsi73
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in the beginning of March and were quite happy with it. The rooms were quite spacious although as earlier mentioned would require little updating. Also the smell of cigarettes lingered in from the other rooms. The airconditioned seemed to be on full blast all the time, unless one switched it off completely. Even so the airconditioning the in the bathroom kept awfully loud noise. However I am a heavy sleeper so it didn't bother me at nights at all. Our room was facing the main road and we did find the noise a bit too loud at times. However the view was nice. Each room includes a kettle so were able to make tea and coffee and the water was provided free of charge by the hotel. The pool was very busy during the day and one had to get in early to get a seat. The pool area was kept very tidy and clean. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. We did not have breakfast included in our room, however there were several restaurants nearby so we used them. There was a good selection of restaurants for dinner as well. The shops nearby are inexpensive and would defenitelly recommend to stroll around them. We used both public transport and taxis to go around. However the metro station is about 20 minutes walk away although one can take a bus to get there. The taxis are cheap too and will take you exactly where you want them to. All in all this hotel was ok although we did miss wifi. There's nothing extra in here and would not recommend it if you wanted a romantic break. However if you want just a place to have a base in then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: ostan14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rydges Plaza in early March 2012, and overall we were happy with our stay. The Rydges is an older style hotel, and therefore lacks the glitz and gaudiness which seems to be the norm in Dubai. However I consider the price we paid to be fair for the facilities on offer. Location wise, the hotel is about 20 minutes walk from the nearest metro, and Sheik Zayed road. Taxis are very cheap in Dubai, so we took advantage of the value and did not use the metro. It costs about 50 Dirham to Mall of the Emirates, and about 20 Dirham to the far superiour Dubai Mall. In the immediate vacinity of the hotel there are plenty of restaurants and supermarkets,and the fast food restaurant across the roundabout offers free wifi. Our room was fine, and like others have mentioned could do with updating. But it was well equipped with mini bar, iron and ironing board, room safe and bizarrely weighing scales!(Now I can only speak for myself, but, when I am on holiiday I rarely feel the need to weigh myself!!!!). I found the room to be very clean, and the bed was very comfortable, can't say the same about the pillows. Our room was at the back of the hotel, and you would hear the calls from the local mosques. However if you are very un-green, and sleep with the air con switched on at night, it will block out the noise and your sleep should not be disturbed. Likewise with the Thursday night music from the bar. My pet hate was the lack of wifi. Now coming from a bankrupt country where free or low cost wifi is readily available, it seems unbelievable that the management of this hotel do not offer wifi in the rooms. Please get with the times! It smacks of greed that wired internet is charged by the hour. We only found out about the free internet access in the business centre by chance, this information was not readily made known. We were on a bed and breakfast package and also visited some of the other outlets in the building. The breakfast buffet was consistently cold, but we got around this by ordering freshly made omlettes. You can also make waffles, and there was loads of different toppings. Staff in this restaurant were very hit and miss, very friendly but seemed put out if you requested a second cup of coffee! I hated the Australian sports bar. It was smokey and dark and felt slightly seedy. On the other hand, the Mexican restaurant on the 8th floor is fab, and you can just go for drinks in a much nicer atmosphere. The pool and jacuzzi were very well kept. Try and grab a sunbed on the side of the pool opposite the hotel building, that way you will be able to enjoy the sun all day long. There is a complimentary bus shuttle to the Jumeria Beach, but you will need to book in advance to ensure a seat. So there you have it. The Rydges Plaza is not the best hotel in Dubai, but neither is it the worst. It is not somewhere to go for a romantic break, but if you are looking for a good base in the city with reasonable facilities, then you can't go wrong with booking a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEtraveller11
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel early Feb 2012, overall it is OK, location wise and all, however, cleanness wise they must improve, on my last day 3rd night I saw blood stain on the other side of the bed. that was disgusting, i can stand anything but not this thing, on other side, the room smelled (smell of smoke) I had to open the window to ventilate the room. otherwise everything was fine...just fine. Also WI-Fi man com on?? why do i have to pay for the internet??

Reviews.Title: “nice and central”
Reviews.Author: romann
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel in oct 2010 and again we were not disappointed with the staff and the quality of the service here it was husbands birthday and they gave him a cake which we really appreciated the rooms were lovely very comfortable and clean everything was so close to us each night we walked down the street for dinner or just look at the shops so many places to chose from and all were quiet cheap catch at taxi to dubai mall for the light and water show or just to see the burj khalifa or the aquarium which is a must to see another good thing about this hotel was the free internet service day or night a special thankyou to irma and nisha and all the staff they made our holiday very special

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: clare_nz_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room for five nights in November. For the price, the room was extremely spacious and luxurious – we had a sofa with coffee table, desk, full wardrobe, large bathroom and entrance hallway. The bed was amazingly comfortable and large, especially if you haven't slept in a decent bed for a while. Internet was complementary and reasonably fast. The décor may feel a bit dated for some but we thought the service and facilities more than made up for it. Every day we went to the pool and gym area to relax and cool down. During the day the pool area is very busy so it pays to come early if you want to sun bathe. The gym is also well equipped and the adjoining bathroom and sauna area is very nice. We ate at the Italian restaurant at the front of the hotel a couple of times and we enjoyed the food there. The Aussie Legends bar was also a good place to grab a beer and relax. In the surrounding area there are much cheaper local food eateries and plenty of supermarkets to buy food from if you're on a tighter budget. To get around we mostly caught buses and used the metro system. Keep in mind that buses don't take cash, only pre-purchased tickets from the metro stations or ticket kiosks. The metro also shuts down on Fridays until 1PM – this caught us out when we were leaving for the airport and we ended up taking a taxi instead. It's about a 15 minute walk from the metro to the hotel. In the height of summer this could be a very painful experience but while we were there in November it was bearable. Taking a taxi around town may be a cheaper option if you're travelling with a larger group of people. For the price, we would definitely stay again next time we're in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a Dubai hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolineWhyte
Reviews.Content: I live in Abu Dhabi & I often stay at the Rydges in Dubai as the location is super convenient (only 10 mns drive from Dubai Mall), The rooms look a bit dated but for a night or 2, who cares? We always go for the executive King room with Bfast included.because in terms of value for money it's a winner deal, no doubt about that, what's more? Great pool and comfi sunloungers... it also has one of Dubai best pizzeria on the ground floor, I strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Suited us just fine”
Reviews.Author: Josie C
Reviews.Content: We spent a night and a day in Dubai last December with our 2 teenage children and found the Rydges Plaza to accommodate all our needs: 2 adjoining rooms that were clean, spacious and comfortable, central location, easy to catch a taxi to places of interest, handy pick up from and drop off to the hotel for our desert safari tour, ample tasty breakfast in a fine breakfast room, very good service and friendly helpful staff. It was a pleasantly memorable 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably prices and a good location”
Reviews.Author: jyotips
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located, and right near the main road. Taxis are reasonably priced. The rooms are old, with the furniture and wall papers wearing out. However at the price, the facilities are well matched with a pool, gym, restaurants etc...I really liked their Italian restaurant at the entrance, and staff is very welcoming

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not so nice location”
Reviews.Author: Zimbardo
Reviews.Content: Very good breakfast and good rooms, but the swimming pool is surrounded by walls behind which is big crossroad, so it may be a little noisy sometimes. Location is not so perfect- not close to beach (15 min walk) or shopping centres (10-15 min taxi), but not far from exhibition centre (5 min taxi).

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed, but value for money”
Reviews.Author: Titiksha
Reviews.Content: To be honest, we had quite a few hiccups at this hotel, beginning from the time of check-in. We went there during the Eid holidays earlier in November and the hotel staff turned down our request for an early check-in. This meant that we had to hang around the property for an hour after lunch and even after we had checked in around 2 pm, the staff took more than an hour to bring our luggage upstairs! We'd booked for four-days and three-nights and our package according to the online booking site, included free internet in the room. At the time of checkin, the staff agreed that internet would be free, but subsequently, the service wouldn't work and when we called reception, they said we'd have to pay for it. After a heated exchange (which ruined our holiday mood), we were told we'd be provided complimentary internet service even though it "usually didn't come free" and that the booking website had mentioned the freebie "by mistake". Anyway, when the internet did start working, the connection was pathetic and none of the emails I tried to send were actually delivered to any of the recipients, as I discovered later! We gave up on this ultimately and tried to concentrate on making the most of our vaccation. The next morning, the hotel shuttle to Jumeriah Beach left without us, that too, five minutes before the scheduled departure time - and with just lone passenger! This, despite reminding the hotel staff the night before that we'd be availaing the complimentary shuttle service to the beach the next day (another promise made online, where the hotel failed to deliver). The best part about the property is that its centrally located on Satwa roundabout and its minimum cab distance to Jumeriah Beach. Which is why we didn't bother about the shuttle service for the rest of our stay. However, the negativity and uncaring attitude of the staff left a bad taste in the mouth which utimately led to my leaving behind my digital camera and mobile phone in a taxi - which ruined our vaccation. All said, the hotel seemed to be grossly understaffed and the ladies manning the reception, especially a young Indian lady, was particularly negligent, rude and utterly unprofessional. Suffice it to say that in a city that has thousands of options, I'd definetely stay somewhere else on our next trip to Dubai. With the exception of a great location, Rydges Plaza doesn't have much to deliver.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful with a good selection of food outlets.”
Reviews.Author: pandas1
Reviews.Content: I knew what to expect having eaten here over the years. room was OK, bathroom pretty grotty. Italian restaurant is fine, also cactus cantina...ok for a stopover..

Reviews.Title: “Don’t Book on Thursdays or Fridays!”
Reviews.Author: Di_Mick78
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Rydges Plaza Dubai in late October along with another travelling couple. The stay was the culmination of a 3 week Mediterranean cruise, so we were looking forward to relaxing in Dubai and seeing a few of its highlights after visiting there 2 years previously. Our flight arrived at midnight and after delays at the airport due to over-officious customs (kept all passengers waiting) and the non-appearance of our hotel transfer, we finally got to the hotel just before 2:00 am. The check-in process was inefficient due to the presence of a couple of young girls who took the staff’s attention away from us. After finally getting our room key we unpacked in our very spacious room on the 3rd level. We found the room met our expectations fully - plenty of space, particularly the bathroom, and the bed was very comfortable. One problem we did encounter was there was only one towel, a problem that was quickly remedied the following day. Our main concern, however, was the loud music coming from the bar on the ground floor. It sounded like it was next door. We love music, but we were desperate for sleep after a long flight. I rang the front desk at 2:30 am and was advised that it was due to finish in 15 minutes. When I asked about the following night I was told that the band plays only on Thursdays and Fridays (this was Friday), so there would be no problem. Our friends were not affected as they were staying on the 6th floor. At 5:00 am we were awakened by the call to prayer which sounded like the loudspeaker was placed on the wall outside our room! Needless to say we had little sleep. The breakfast was good, although coffee/tea service was a bit slow. Each day we were supplied with large bottles of water free – a nice touch. Taxis are a must due to the hotel’s location and the heat. The porter service was very good – he was very friendly and helpful. We made use of the Aussie Bar to watch the World Cup Rugby Final and had a great time although the venue was not smoke-free. We have stayed at Rydges hotels before in Australia and have found them very good. This stay was a disappointment to us because of the first night’s interruptions and sloppy check-in service. The rest of the time we were happy with the hotel’s services but I doubt we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: leswull
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay here for 3 nights. Staff very friendly and approachable. Only a short (ish) walk to metro for cheap trips round Dubai, very reliable too. Aussie bar had a happy hour-bliss. Would recommend this hotel to anybody. Read a couple of poor reports before we stayed here and I am glad to say we had no problems at all. I think some people deliberately look for faults and if they can't find any they make them up!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Food”
Reviews.Author: TopCatTony
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the suites this time, extremely clean, roll top bath and double basin. The beds are all very big and comfortable. The food in Rustico is as good as any Italian I've eaten in, don't stay without trying the wood oven pizza's! Looking forward to my next trip to Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stop”
Reviews.Author: Jingo2
Reviews.Content: I stay here quite often on business. Excellent location for getting around. Some rooms may need a bit of updating but the staff always have a warm welcome in store and personally I prefer to avoid the stuffiness of the 5 star hotel scene where everywhere looks and feels the same. I will definitely be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Shuggy66
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times. 1 week, 1 month and for 2 months. I would definitely go back. Now don't get me wrong it does have it's faults but it's just got a great atmosphere and it is cheap by any standards. The decor is tierd and some rooms are worse that others. However it is very comfortable and clean and you can see it was once lovely when new but now dated. Nice pool area, good gym. Bars & Restaurants in hotel: Billy Blues - Steak, burgers etc. bar and pool table. Great service fantastic steaks. Fun, many locals use it too. Indian Restaurant. Excellent. Chinese restaurant. Not so good really but if you like Karoke you'll be in heaven. Basic. Four Seasons Italian; Atmospheric, great food. St Andres pub. Bit like a british pub, sort of. Quiet, except when the football is showing. Bar food of average quality. Opens out onto the pool area. The Aussie Bar. Quite big and is a club like venue with live bands some nights, quiz nights etc. Old and a bit dirty but very lively and great fun every night. Big sreens showing sport, bar food and pizzas. Another restaurant on ground floor. I only had breakfast in this one and I advise you do not bother with that. Cannot comment on other meal times menus. Light and airy atmosphere. So, a great range within a small hotel. It is used by a lot of locals for it's restaurants and for parties. This was never a problem for me as a guest. The restaurant are on the ground floor and on the top floor. Non guests use a separate lift and cannot access the other floors. Staff were either good or excellent. The area is old town and authentic but not far by cab from new town. You either like that or not. If you want to be in the glitzy Dubai of the brochures get yourself down town. I liked the area, you can get your washing done and pressed for next to nothing in the many surrounding laundrettes. Hair cut for about £3 and a great shave. Really easy to get Dubai taxis here or use the chaufeur drivers parked out front. More expensive of course but they will go out of their way for you all through your stay. Just ask and they will know how to assist. Good Basic Hotel, no fuss or frills. I have stayed here with up to 20 colleagues and even the ones who are more accustomed to 5 star living eventually warmed to it's charms. You cannot fault this hotel for the price you pay. Go with an open mind and you wont be dissapointed. If you are unlucky with your room ask to change, as I say some are not as good as others.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for Dubai standards and reasonably good”
Reviews.Author: Xenophon2NewDelhi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the Satwa roundabout in the area with the same name. It's a relatively authentic area with many small shops and restaurants selling stuff at less than astronomical prices. I don't know why a previous reviewer mentioned problems with taxi travel because my wife and I took taxis all the time from the hotel area to other parts of Dubai or Sharjah and never had to wait longer than 2 minutes. The hotel itself is ok, it needs a lick of paint but the rooms are certainly good value for money if you can get it for about 450-500 AED (prices fluctuate widely). The reason I'm giving it 3 stars is that the breakfast buffet is expensive for what you get at 60 AED/person and that they charge a hefty supplement for internet connectivity. Also, my wife and I woke up one night at 3:30 AM due to someone wishing to deliver room service to us (we hadn't ordered anything) and hammering on the door despite the 'Do not disturb' sign. Other than that, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “atrocious service in out-of-the-way location”
Reviews.Author: dr_iggy
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews here, I guess I must have been very unlucky. While the rooms seem to be quite good value for Dubai and are big (my room had the hugest bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel) the whole place needed a facelift. And while other reviewers praise the great service here, I only seemed to encounter arrogant, inflexible and unfriendly staff, especially at reception (and no, I am not a demanding or fussy type who elicits this sort of response). I also stopped having breakfast here due to the cluelessness and inefficiency of the waitstaff. I also found that while Rydges seemed to be central to everywhere (on a map, at least), it was essentially in the middle of nowhere, and this became a big problem for me, given the difficulty of taxi travel in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Option in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: PixelsnFluff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night last weekend and were quite happy with our stay. The hotel is located in a central part of the city, but not in the immediate tourist fray. It's a quick taxi ride or drive to many of the most popular destinations. Our room was spacious, clean and appointed well. The decor is a bit dark and slightly dated, but not terribly run-down. We were in an executive type room that came with a wired internet connection, had a small sitting area and had access to a lounge with drinks around the clock and hors d'oeuvres for a couple hours in the evening (nothing special the night we were there). The breakfast buffet included with the room was ok. There was a plentiful choice of foods, fresh fruits, cereals, etc., but none of the cooked foods were spectacular. We also ate a quick meal in the afternoon at the Italian restaurant next to the lobby and it was very good, with fast service. We will certainly return to Rydges for its overall level of quality and friendly service at a quite reasonable price and good location within the city.

Reviews.Title: “Well done Rydges!”
Reviews.Author: Nathanrosetravel
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to leave a positive comment about our recent trip to Rydges Plaza Dubai. Service was sensational, food was incredible at all venues and the breakfast was very fresh. Rooms were very comfortable with lots of space and full of all the modern cons. Definetely stay here if your planning on going to Dubai and they also have a very cool Aussie bar if your an Aussie this is a nice little treat to escape the crazy Dubai world outside. Thanks again Rydges! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: DiscoB
Reviews.Content: I would recommend staying in this hotel. Room was large, bed very comfortable and cleaned everyday. We ate at the Mexican restaurant which was very nice and drank in the Aussie Legends bar every night which we loved – had pub quiz, live music etc. Hotel is a little out of the way location wise, however it seems that you have to get taxi's everywhere is Dubai anyway as their transport system is virtually non-existent. Pool area was lovely, fairly small pool for the size of the hotel however there were rarely people around it so not a problem. Personally I would not go to Dubai during the summer months as it was too hot and this limited what we could do.

Reviews.Title: “one night stopover”
Reviews.Author: gazza810
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with mercury direct as a stopover on the way back from sri lanka just for one night and for the convenience and ease from the airport. We arrived at approx 1400 hours and left at 0430hrs so this will be a brief review. The check in was very efficient and the staff very helpful, we were allocated a room on the 4th floor room 417, which if you look from the outside is facing the main road and just to the right of ther entrance.As it was over a main road it made it quite noisy during the night, i dont think Dubai ever sleeps. The room itself was well presented however the bathroom was quite dated, this didnt bother us as we were here for less than 24hours. All rooms have WiFi, TV, minibars. The hotel is easily located so that either the metro or a taxi to the burj mall was no problem at all, the concierge was only to helpful to get them for you. The hotel has a pool, which we didnt use. It also has various restaurants (italian) a themed bar called aussie legends with different entertainment every night and food was also available and various other venues for drink and food which we never tried due to lack of time. Would i stay here again i would probably say yes, but for over 24hours this time, why pay the extortinate rates in the top hotels to stay in Dubai when you can pay a pittance and still be in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: TripperC2010
Reviews.Content: Centrally located. Near the main roundabout, easy to grab a taxis to old or new parts of town. The closest metro station is an easy 20 minute walk. The rooms are huge, with an alcove - couch and coffee table. Classically fitted out with wood panelling. Great pool and spa, good gym, nice cafe and the Italian restaurant was good. Staff were very friendly and helpful. It is around 20 min from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED MY STAY AND GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: rouffar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the city of satwa surrounded by shops and restaurants all walking distance. the obvious are KFC and pizza hut. We were surprised as to how beautiful the hotel was only being 3 star. should defo be a 4 star at the least! rooms were very clean and spacious with a great view of the burj khalifa tower and a nice view of the roundabout of satwa. nice scene. the drinks at the hotel are very expensive so recommend you buy all that from duty free, we bought belevedere and grey goose vodka at duty free for 120 dirhams for each bottle- very cheap!!! Also cigarette cartons were cheap! airport to the hotel was no longer than a 15 mins journey and didnt cost much especially when your splitting the bill between four girls. There was a guy by the name of armando at the hotel and he was always assisting us with everything and gave us great advice. We had many friendly laughters with him. The hotel has a bar where they do great cocktails but its not open for long but a great place to mingle and meet new people and have a few drink ups before going out. they have a chinese restaurant, indian and an italian restaurant all of which are slightly pricey but very good food. we had a slight issue with the hotel concierge as they tried charging us something like 50 dirhams for a cigarette burn on their linen but after a heated discussion with the hotel manager he was more thann happy to take that off the bill which was useful. We were surprised as to how centrrally located this hotel was. everyone is friendly and do their best to help. they have a hotel jacuzzi and a pool area with sun loungers and its very nice to go out in the morning have a swim, grab some breakfast and ehad out. when in dubai visit the following: - burjamaan mall, dubai mall and mall of emirates. My favourite was the dubai mall and you have the aquarium whcih you could visit in there. Mall od emirates is nice as they have the ski dubai and definately would recommend you visit! try out the 4x4 desert safari, Dubai city tour where you visit the gould souk (defo a must as the gold is cheap when you haggle!) Also visit the waterpark in atlantis the best waterpark I have ever been to in my life. the burj khalifa tour was great views of dubai and the burj al arab at night time looks amazing. clubs to visit: cavalli club, armani club and another club beginning with B but cant remember!! visited in June 2011 and would defo recmmend that you visit! loved every minute of i!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: BrianR6
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel for a stopover and at a good price too. Situation is great about halfway between the creek and Dubai mall and also halway between the metro and the beach. Plenty of choice for eating and drinking in the hotel, nice rooms great pool for a quick relax and an extensive buffet brerakfast even though we were there in Ramadan. Where else could you sit drinking English cider served by Phillipino waitresses in an Australian bar in a Dubai hotel who couldn't serve untill 8:00 pm becasue of Ramadan. How cosmolitan is that. Local area is good if you want to experience locla Arab food and shopping away from the malls

Reviews.Title: “Over all great but needs some improvement”
Reviews.Author: moonhopper
Reviews.Content: we stayed ta the Rydges for 3 nights. The service is great. we cheeked in at 6am with no waiting. The room is fine but need to be updated. the bathroom is big but there isn't a lot of hot water or pressure in shower or toilet. The restaurants are good but a tad on the expensive side for what you get. The reception is very helpful with any of you questions you have about Dubai. It was little out of the way of things. it was always a cab ride to things. Over all i would stay here if your budget wasn't huge but if you have the money there are other places i would have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, really liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Annane
Reviews.Content: I and a friend stayed here for little over a week and liked it a lot. Big bath with both shower and tub, spacious rooms, excellent service, nice breakfast. Supercomfy beds and pillows! It all felt authentic and we loved the area, too, lots of really good restaurants close by and an excellent beauty salon called Pretty Lady that we visited several times for massages, pedicures and manicures. :) Only downside I can think of is the pool area which is rather small.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: BusinessGuruLondon
Reviews.Content: Pool area fine but rest of hotel tired and quite noisy. Also, Taxi drivers don't always know here it is... Better options and similar price

Reviews.Title: “pleased once again”
Reviews.Author: Colinc47
Reviews.Content: My wife and i recently stayed, for the second time, at the Rydges Plaza and were once again more than pleased with the overall standard of the amenities and the service that we received. Having first stayed there 4 years ago we were looking forward to our return visit but were a little apprehensive as things are not always the same when you go back. However we were not disappointed. The room was good, the food was excellent and the staff extremely friendly and helpfull from the moment that we arrived until we checked out. The only negative this time was that if you are a non-smoker then the St. Andrews bar and the Aussie Legends bar will not be for you and the Chinese restaurant has a karaoke every night and is extremely noisy. Shame because the last time we visited the Chinese was a really lovely meal and the restaurant has a view to die for at night. But these are not really a problem as there are numerous other options for you to get a meal and a drink. If you are visiting The Rydges Plaza it is well worth applying on-line for a guest priority card before you go as this can save you a lot of money on your meals and drinks. Overall it was another thoroughly enjoyable stay and we would certainly revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend At A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: santa002 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend break at this hotel, found staff fantastic from minuite we walked in. This is a small hotel by Dubai standards but we loved that, it had a personal feel to it that others just cannot offer. Check in was easy, room large and spotless, however the room is dated, by that we mean no flat screen etc, but more than made up for by feel of the place. This is an older style hotel with solid walls and a lovely colonial feel to it. Had a great meal in the Italian resteraunt, Great time in the Austrailian Bar, just loved the weekend. This is not a hotel though for children, it has a spotless pool, in lovely courtyard surrounding but it certaily does not have the space for children to run around etc. Very well located to most of Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good Services but Poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gulf-Neil
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel on many occassions to eat in the restaurants & drink/eat in the bars - all of which are very nice. However, I have just paid AED550 to stay a night on the 5th floor (executive) & was really disappointed. The room was clean but VERY small & breakfast limited. You can get a lot more for your money in a myraid of other hotels in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: gaya_2511
Reviews.Content: This hotel is too good for your stay. Very friendly staff and helpful. Rooms are clean. Free drop and pick up to the Jumeira beach. Good internet connection (free). overall i would rate that this hotel is very good! Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value for money”
Reviews.Author: gillykLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Searched high and low for a reasonable hotel on Jumeirah beach but as I failed miserably I began searching elsewhere and thank goodness I did. We travelled as two couples celebrating a 50th birthday. The hotel is quite old and probably a little old fashioned furnishings etc but do not let that put you off. We arrived late at night from queuing for ages at immigration at Dubai Airport where all officials are more interested in playing on their blackberries than letting people into the country. Taxi fare very reasonable. 50 Dirhams using airport taxis but returning from hotel only 23 Dirhams. Reception staff very helpful and efficient. We had booked 2 executive rooms that were inclusive of very adequate cooked breakfast and a great deal of free alcohol and canapes every evening between 6 and 8pm. We really made use of this as alcohol is quite expensive especially wine and beer. In fact the hotel were probably glad to get rid of us as we were the first in and last out every evening. It is worth upgrading as it is only a few pounds more!!! Rooms had huge beds and were very comfortable and quiet. Occasionally heard the call to prayer but hey you are in Dubai after all. We left our camera either in the hotel or in a taxi and the security staff trawled through the cctv for us. Unfortunately we did not get it back and we had not downloaded last photos so lost a lot of very personal photos of family etc. This was very upsetting as we tried taxi companies etc but the staff at Rydges were exemplary. Swimming pool lovely but a bit too warm. Same as in most very hot countries though. St Andrews Bar and Aussie |Bar did show lots of sport especially every premiership game you wanted. That was very important to us. I think there are about 7 restaurants in the hotel from pub grub to Mexican to Italian and more. All are of a reasonable quality. There is a gym but we did not bother. About 5 mins by taxi from beach and Dubai Mall etc. Be careful in taxis as they do tend to go round the world. Should cost about 16 to 20 Dirhams to get to Dubai mall and a little less for the beach. Saying that the hotel does have a free shuttle bus to the beach a couple of times a day. Ex pats frequent the bars and restaurants and all of them said this was by far the best hotel in Dubai if you do not want to be ripped off by hotels on beach. Fantastic stay all round. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “For business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Tebessa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights in April 2011. Rooms are confy and quiet, even with a view to the roundabout. Hotel has a pool with sunbeds which were just fine for me as a business traveller. For a holiday trip these wouldn't be enough though as surroundings don't excately ooze holiday feeling. Hotel has several restaurants and bars. I tried Italian and Mexican, latter one can be highly recommended. Lots of shops close by and free transportation to Jumeirah beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great choice of dining options”
Reviews.Author: MAIDENHEADUK
Reviews.Content: Had often used great Italian restaurant here but had never stayed before . Now i will make this my regular base in Dubai. Very impressed with spacious rooms and friendly staff although reception definitely need some more training . Great location in Satwa which is miore like the real old Dubai that i used to know 20 years ago and not the artificial clinical luxury onbsessed one of today.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: 186338Sandy
Reviews.Content: We just spent 8 nights at this hotel and found it excellent value, friendly, clean and very central for sightseeing. It is approx 1/2 mile to the Metro Station at Al Jafiliya, and the bus stops are just outside too. We ate at the Coconut Grove on the ninth floor, excellent food and great views of the city. The nearby Al Diyafa St comes to life in the evenings and has so many great places to eat, try Ravis opposite for a great curry... our bill was £6 for two and we couldn't eat it all!!. The supermarkets stay open till midnight too. We visited all over, but looked forward to coming back to this area each evening, its very cosmopolitan and was much more friendly than the high end areas like Dubai Marina. Will definitely return. Oh, and join the Rydges priority guests scheme before you book and you'll get discounted room rates and 20% of all food and drink too

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccoaster
Reviews.Content: We spent the one night at this hotel on the way to europe , got into Dubai around 2.00pm and it was around 40 degrees. Got to the hotel and straight for the pool , it was like a bath. But I think this Dubai normally. Hotel located in easy to get to spot by taxi from airport and out to the berj kalif and other sights. The staff are freindly and the rooms clean and comfortable. On our return trip we spent 3 nights here and upgraded to the king suites , with the you get a free 2 hour session each day in a dedicated bar with free drinks and nibbles. This is good value. The area around has some good cheap resturants and a mile of gold dealers and the mad shops you get in these parts. All inall a good value hotel and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel, But very clean, comfortable and I liked it”
Reviews.Author: DazzaMeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by no means modern. It is older and inside the rooms look older and a bit dated. Having said that, very thing worked and both inside and out were very very clean. All staff were very helpful and I had no issues with my stay. I had a executive room which came with free breakfast and evening drinks. The breakfast is buffet and was really good a wide selection of food from hot (Hash browns, sausage bacon eggs etc) to fruit and yogurt to bread with spreads. For those feeling or needed to get a bit fit the gym is well equiped. The pool is lovely although I throught it was a little too warm. The spa was very relaxing. The location is on 'eat street'. The tourist double deck bus passes by the front door. And its within walk distance to the creek (winter only). Taxi's are the way to go cheap and metered. My only issues was my seven am wake up call courtsey of the Dubai Fire Department who test there sirens daily at that time. But it was barable. Overall excellent hotel, good location, good value, worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJGC_2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this hotel in an executive club room. I would highly recommend this hotel as it is central to most things. The staff were very helpful in recommending things to do - the hop on hop off bus and safari 4x4 are a must when in Dubai. Breakfast staff also introduced us to local breakfast, very nice. They have several food and bar outlets including a cool Australian Bar. Shopping centre is across the road. Taxis are very cheap in Dubai so best way of getting around. If going to Dubai - try to go on a Friday as they are very big on their Friday Brunches. Friday and Saturdays are their weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulblenk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2010 while the hotel is not on the flashy beach resorts of Dubai its in the old part of the city were tourist and workers eat in the small cafes.THe hotel by Dubai standards is small and a bit dated but dont let this put you of staying here as everything about this hotel is fantastic .We stayed on the executive floor which is worth the extra money which included breakfast unlimited soft drinks tea &coffee through the day and free drinks and nibbles between 6pm &8pm also free internet all day in the executive lounge The rooms were very clean with seperate bath and shower and large king size bed. Breakfast choice was good with the normal selections of hot and cold foods with eggs etc cooked to order. The swimming pool was very clean the hotel also does a shuttle service to a local beach. The hotel also had good options for food and drinks from allday pub food in the st andrews bar to Italian,chinese indian,mexican,american outlets there is also an Aussie sports bar which showed all the English football live and stayed open late with music most nights. We only ate in st andrews and the italian and both were very good With this hotel being small by dubai standards the staff get to know you very quickly and the service in every depatment of the hotel was first class if there is a slight downside to the hotel is it is situated next to a busy roundabout and the local fire station but dont let this put you of staying at this very good hotel this was our second visit and will certainley use on our next visit to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ppxyz
Reviews.Content: Pros:- A decent no frills hotel. Nice pool. Excellent staff. Centrally located. Got an executive room where breakfast was included and also there was an executive lounge. Taxis never a problem. Free shuttle to beach needs to be booked 3 hrs in advance. If you are looking for a hotel where you have come for sightseeing and most of the time you will be outside, this has best value for money. Free Internet at room Cons:- The bathroom toilet needs to be updated. Breakfast was repetitive. Needs some changes there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service! Nice rooms. Great restaurants. Great location. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: weir64
Reviews.Content: I've just stayed 25 days in Rydges Plaza Dubai and highly recommend it. The service of the staff is exceptional. A perfect combination of friendlyness and proffesionalism. Rooms are nice and always clean. Not the most modern crisp design, but for an extended stay I prefer the wam homely feel of these rooms anyway. Beatifully comfortable beds! Such an important feature. I love the location in the 'downtown' type area. Its just outside the glitz and glamour of 'new' dubai but offers so many options for restaurants, shopping etc within short walking distance. And of course nothing is far by taxis, which are always available outside. The majority of my stay was during Ramadan, which can be an inconvient time to be in Dubai for non-muslims. This makes the hotel you stay in even more important as you rely on it even more. I have stayed at other more expensive hotels in Dubai, but will now always stay at Rydges. I have no reason to look for anything else now. The title says it all really. Mike

Reviews.Title: “Great room, food & service”
Reviews.Author: Bob_1_man
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 nights earlier this month. Although the hotel is older than others in Dubai it has a great location. I found it to be nicely refurbished, clean with very helpful and friendly staff. The food in the restaurants is good quality, tasty and well presented. Good sized swimming pool with an attendant on duty. Hotel is located in a central position, with a taxi always on hand to enable you to travel door to door to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “An overall excellent hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Kaper64
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were all extremely friendly and helpful. Although we arrived at 7am, we were able to get our room immediately and catch up on our sleep after a long flight. The hotel' location is quite central - the nearest metro station is about a 15 minute walk away and you can reach the main downtown attractions and shopping malls within 10 minutes by taxi. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Rydges Plaza Dubai and look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: AwkwardGuest93
Reviews.Content: Initially seeing the reviews on this website, i was sceptic when I found out that we would be stopping at this hotel. Despite this, I was pleasantly suprised. The hotel is clean, spacious, and the staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The hotel boasts many bars and restaurants, we left early on the last morning, and we decided not to have breakfast, so we asked for a refund. They said this would not be possible, however they put the breakfast on an hour and a half earlier than usual for us! I've stayed in The Mirage in Las Vegas, and The Waldorf Astoria in New York, and countless five star hotels in London, and I can honestly say that this hotel was probably one of the best for service. In regard to earlier comments about the hotel being dated, I wouldn't say this, I would say it is decorated in a more classic style, rather than the modern style of other dubai hotels. As for location, Dubai is spreadout over a large area and walking anywhere is like suicide, ask at the reception about city tours, there's usually some guys outside who are willing to take you around in classy lexuses for 80DHS an hour, which is insanely cheap, and you get to see all the sites that you want to, and they will drop you off at the malls for an hour or so, then pick you up, and let you leave your shopping in the car, a great experience overall. These guys can also organise airport transfers for 50DHS. The food in the hotel is great too, you can sit in the lobby and snack on some nachos or potato wedges quite cheaply, whilst sipping on one of their milkshakes, which come highly recommended! As for the other facilities, the hotel has a pool which is warm and clean, and also a spa bath, both with a lifeguard on duty, and a nearby bar. I didnt have time to use the gym facilities, but my brother recommended them. As I mentioned earlier, walking anywhere is a no go zone in Dubai, but you can see the Burj Dubai (the tallest building in the world, from the entrance to the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a good hotel in a slightly inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: dman-and-teamgreen
Reviews.Content: For a one night stop over, this hotel is perfect - reasonable rates, friendly staff, quality rooms and facilities. Unless you have a car its a real hike to anywhere, so you'll be getting taxis or tours to all the "sights". Truth be told I find Dubai to be a little like Las Vegas meets Singapore, with the charm of neither - a convoluted bunch of skyscrapers in the desert (Well OK I suppose Las Vegas has very little charm). The beaches are meant to be lovely but I couldn't find any that weren't private and closed off, the air is thick with an "LA smog" look/feel to it, and the shopping malls are as big and soul-less as any other countries. But it is a handy stop over for long haul flights, so if I had to stop here again I would consider this hotel, unless I was convinced to stay longer, in which case I'd look to be closer to perhaps the Old Souks or some of the other "stuff" worth seeing, such as the river.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing considering other people's rave reviews”
Reviews.Author: TahleePerth
Reviews.Content: Flew in from Cairo so it was a late arrival. Got to the hotel and they had booked us into a smoking room (we are non-smokers) even though we specified non-smoking. It stank and was very dingy. Next day asked to be moved to non smoking and it was organized. This room was clean and spacious but so noisy. We were right over looking the Satwa traffic roundabout and the "local Hoons" did car and motor bike racing around the roundabout every night til about 3 am. If there was soundproofing it wasn't working! Couldn't close the window properly, couldn't adjust the airconditioner - just had to switch it off. Also the toilet leaked. Coincidentially the air conditioning in the breakfast area was broken too and they had a major flooding in the mens restroom near the foyer while we were staying. This hotel needs a serious face lift to justify its 4 star rating. My only recommendation was the Italian restaurant - really excellent food and great prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Nazrienz
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Dubai airport approx 0330hrs local time, not sure where to go but decided to try my luck to get early check in surprisingly they manage to give me the room. The staff there are very friendly and helpful. We really enjoy our stay there. Room is very clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “here again. very good service as always”
Reviews.Author: VANBREDA
Reviews.Content: I have already written about htis hotel. even if I stay in this hotel since long time, quality of service never goes down. very helpfull at front desk. it is not that new anymore but still very clean and well managed. Roberto

Reviews.Title: “Great service and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: anita3695
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous when booking this hotel as I did not know much about Rydges or Dubai and the hotel was quite reasonably priced compared to others in Dubai . However, we were very pleasantly surprised. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was clean and had lots of restaurants and a lovely pool. We tried the Italian restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed it - also had a discount for being a Rydges Priority GUEST (not chargeable). The service in this hotel was excellent. Convenient location for most places in Dubai. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Stopover”
Reviews.Author: alyfenSheffieldUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not pretentious and I would not recommend it if you were staying for a long period, as it does feel a bit 'businessy' but for a stopover it was perfect, bed was comfy and room spacious. It was our first trip to Dubai and boy was it hot! I mean really hot, don't expect to be able to wander round outside in the sunshine in September - the sunlight hurt my eyes (as the song goes!) Rydges had good aircon; a very good breakfast and spacious room which, whilst a little dated, had everything we needed - tea and coffee, complimentary water and including iron and ironing board. While we were there the pool was being refurbished and this was a bit of a disapppointment as when we arrived we could have done with a cool off in the pool - never mind. There is so much to if you are just stopping over, you really don't have time to laze! Dubai is fascinating and our highlight there was the Bateaux Dubai cruise on the creek - this is something I would highly recommend (dinner was first class - wine was first class price!). Malls were amazing and I'm sure we missed loads - museum was great.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul38
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in May. The hotel is situated on Satwa roundabout which is about half way between Bur Dubai and the north end of Jumeirah beach. Also, Sheikh Zayed Road is only about a mile away (In fact, you get a fantastic view of the tall buildings along SZR). The staff here are extremely polite and professional. As this hotel is smaller than the grand five star hotels the staff can offer a more personal service. I arrived at the hotel before 7am but was offered a twin room immediately. However, as I wanted a room with a king size bed I opted to wait until one was available. They let me use the showers in the gym in the meantime. Due to the recession the room rates had been reduced since I booked so the manager arranged for my prebooked rate to be amended which saved me quite alot. There are several restaurants here although I didn't try any because Al Dhiyafa Road is teeming with good (and cheap) restaurants. The hotel offers an airport shuttle but a taxi is cheaper. There is a swimming pool, jacuzzi and sun loungers on the first floor with a gym adjacent to it. A good tip is to join Rydges Priority Guest Club; it's free to join and you get a 10% discount on the room rate and 20% off of other hotel services. There is a laundry very close by which only charges six dirhams per item (much cheaper than hotel laundry rates), and a male hair and nail salon called Diva on Al Dhiyafa Road (well worth a visit gents!). All in all, a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Claudioka
Reviews.Content: big and clean room, excellent location in the middle of Dubai, good distance from souq and Jumeirah, all taxies know where Satwa roundabout is, excellent service they helped us to contact flight company for details and more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: macca61gers
Reviews.Content: I was working in Dubai initially for 7 days it ended up 17 days, I was booked in "Le Meridien " for the first week but decided to stay for the next 10 days somewhere half the price which did include Breakfast, I thought the service, the rooms, the restaurants where all excellent and the location is good for the main streets, I would definitely stay here again when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Rydges Plaza”
Reviews.Author: danmac1504
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Rydges. Stayed three nights on business. This is very sad to say but i have finally stayed at a hotel where the iron actually irons creases out of the clothes. This wasn't the only good point but is worth mentioning. The rooms are spacious, clean. The hotel has several restaurants, chinese, indian, american, mexican, aussie and italian. Only tried the italian (superb) and aussie (very nice). The Aussie legends bar is good, watched grand prix on massive screen. Supermarket and shops close by, taxis easy to get hold of. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: otty78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights en route from the UK to Australia as we wanted to see some of Dubai and break the trip up a little. The hotel is situated on a busy roundabout in a business district. The rooms are very large with very big and comfy bed, big bathroom and living area with sofa. The TV was good with 2 english film channels and cnn and bbc news. The hotel has an aussie legends bar which opens till about 3am and has pool table and tv's etc but i warn you now, if you like a drink or two, take plenty of dirhams... Alcohol is very expensive.. A pint of beer, ie stella, heinekin or guinness will set you back circa 35 dirhams.. at the current rate of about 5 to the £.. it works out to about 7 quid a pint !!!! Spirits and wine even more expensive. This is the same as everywhere in Dubai. The hotel has a good choice of restaurants, indian, chinese, italian etc and again it certanily isnt cheap but very nice. Roughly expect to pay 15-20 quid each for a steak or decent main course. Most attractions are a cheapish taxi ride away but not walkable. Taxi's arent expensive and you can get to most attractions for less than a tenner. The airport is only 10 mins away too. On the way back from Oz we again stayed in Dubai for one night but this time at the Arabian Park Hotel. This was in a better location right near Wafi Shopping mall where all the good shops and restaurants are and is only three years old so is very contempory inside with a nicer pool area although smaller rooms..... If i was to return i would probably stay there rather than the rydges but both are nice. Any questions please feel free to email me

Reviews.Title: “Good , but could be much better”
Reviews.Author: SilversurferFife
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the first time a few years ago, only for a couple of days stopover. Could not get the Arabian Courtyard so used here as a fall back. We stayed nine nights. It was better than average, but some of the staff need training in customer care and smiling! We stayed on the Ex Floor, and it was probably not worth the extra cost. It got very crowded on the last couple of days and that really stretched the hotel services and staff. Food generally was good although we had one bad expereince in the Italian outlet. Not handled very well. Would recommend for a few days, we probably just stayed too long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing flash.”
Reviews.Author: North East Star
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rydges Plaza for 2 nights on a stop off from Mauritius and although by standards in Dubai it is relatively small, but UK standards it would be classed as large. Rooms are olde English style, but fairly large with a big bathroom and our room had huge full length windows with amazing views over the Marina side of the city. It is situated in the shopping district and is on a roundabout on a very busy main road, but taxis are easy to get right outside the hotel. Hotal staff are extremely nice and the pool area is lovely. There are 9 restaurants in total. Although being we were only there 2 nights we tried the Mexican restaurant which didn't serve much Mexican food and the English pub which served great pub lunches. We booked this through Mercury Direct and they were very impressive as all our transfers were seamless and their representative who came to see only us at the hotel couldn't have been more helpful and he also booked us a tour of Dubai which I would strongly recommend if you are only there a short time. For £40 a SUV vehicle took us anywhere we wanted to go.....so over 5 hours with him we saw almost everything. Tips include Souk market and Jumeira Beach. The rep also booked us for dinner at Burj Al Arab, which was something else. He also persuaded us not to book a la carte and go for the buffet, which was amazing. £150 for 2 people (drinks not included), also a trip up to the Skyview Bar is well worth it, although cocktails are £25. The Rydges Plaza really appealed to us as we didn't have to find our way around a huge hotel and was well situated. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “good average place to stay”
Reviews.Author: oldtraveller_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed two years running. Staff good and helpful. Couple of nice bars, particularly an Aussie one. Breakfast included in tariff and very plentiful. Central to most areas. Nothing really flash compared to some of the Dubia places but clean, comfortable with a price to match. Would class it about 4 star Australian standard Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Hotel friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DoncasterRover
Reviews.Content: We wanted to try Dubai while the shopping festival was on we had never been before, a friend had stopped at Rydges a few years ago and recommended we might look at it. Web site was good and accurate, important point join the Rydges priority club and save from memory 10% immediatley on accomodation Plus the card gives you discount on drinks and meals, about the location Hotel get a cab from the Airport about 45AED part of that is about 20AED supplement from the airport ,going back was only 25AED. Hotel located centrally on Satwa roundabout taxi 15 to 20AED to Jumeriah beach and 5 AED to get in marvellous beach and facilities. Hotel can't fault food Mexican, Chinese, American, Indian, Italian Restaurants used them all typical meal in all 45 AED and each night one has a special 2 for the price of 1 plus UK and Aussie style pub with food. In terms of food and drink no real need to leave the Hotel on the evening, there are typical restaurants Lebonese, Chinese, Thai, Indian and of course local ones on the surrounding streets near the Hotel. Breakfast in the Hotel think it was 65 AED a little pricey but first class and set you up for the day, altenatively turn right outside the Hotel and down the street 100metres. You will find the Organic Supermarket and Cafe, great value for food and meals in the Cafe breakfast 25AED. Hotel fabulous central base, some of the Hotels you see on the Web sites are 20 - 25 mins from the center of things. Traffic in all areas manic between say 8.00am till 10.00am and 5.00pm to 8.00pm so avoid these times. In summary great value central accomodation, our room was spotless all staff excellent....the pool area is good for swimming and Sun bathing. Can't say anything negative on our experience. Phil Doncaster

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: OliversArmy
Reviews.Content: 16yrs ago, I flew to Dubai to take part in the Dubai 7's - I'd arrived ahead of my fellow team-mates and we were all supposed to be staying in the Chicago Beach Hotel. When I got to arrivals a man from the Chicago Beach was waiting for me and with profuse apologies explained that the hotel was overbooked and for the first night, they had re-housed me in a different hotel - little did I know that I would be staying in the same hotel 16yrs later! The Rydges Plaza has had a few bad reviews on here - primarily it would seem due to either the furnishings or the location. I would like to challenge these reviews as I've just got back from a very pleasant 4 night stay here. It's not a theme park, it's not a luxury enormodrome and it's not by the beach. It is VERY central, and it's got some character. LOCATION: Right on Satwa Roundabout, the hotel is minutes (depending on the traffic!) from the creek, the airport, Sheikh Zayed Road, the beach, anywhere. The taxis are cheap, safe and regular. OK, so there's a fire station opposite and a mosque over the road - but what do you expect, it's a city centre hotel not a luxury beach hotel. The local area is full of decent cheap restaurants, and there's a supermarket 3 mins walk away. ROOMS: The rooms are large, well furnished spotless. The bed in our room was very comfortable and absolutely massive. The bathroom was large, with a huge walk-in shower and plenty of smellies etc. TV was good - plenty of channels (BBC/Star etc). EATING/DRINKING: Breakfast was great - tasty and fresh, staff very attentive. There are about 6 eating establishments in the hotel - didn't use them at all other than for a sandwich by the pool for lunch - which was fine. There's a Chinese, a decent Indian, Mexican, American and Aussie Bar. The bar, Aussie Legends was packed on the Thursday - decent enough prices for a beer too. FACILITIES A small but perfectly adequate pool area - not really a hotel for sunbathing. Large gym/health club. Business Area. Internet access etc. Overall an excellent hotel, spotlessly clean, staff who went out of their way to ensure that we were well looked after. Maybe I don't expect the world when I check into a hotel but I know what I want & I know what I like - and this one ticked all the right boxes.

Reviews.Title: “a bit dingy”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Colours
Reviews.Content: Bedroom was dark, dingy, depressing and didn't smell great. The internet connection was dial-up so, unless they fitted broadband since, no use for the business traveller. Breakfast was about OK, Italian is a kind of pizza restaurant, Aussie bar great, and a Keralese curry house which is spot on. Located on a noisy roundabout within walking distance of nowhere. Staff were pleasant enough but overall quite depressing and not a place you would want spend a lot of time in. Interestingly though, they had the EvertonFC TV channel which was a nice surprise. Might go back to the curry house.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Dubai”
Reviews.Author: AusScotTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 year old son, and I stayed at the Rydges Plaza in Dubai for one night in August on the way to the UK from Melbourne in a Deluxe Room, and then 3 nights in an Executive Room on the way back home to Melbourne in September. We found the Rydges to be a great hotel, which although was a little dated in it's decor, was clean, comfortable and central to everything that we wanted to do in Dubai. The staff were sensational (they seemed to love our son!), the breakfasts were great value, the restaurants reasonable and it was a great place to relax by the pool and recharge the batteries after a long flight. I would recommend the Executive Room as you are entitled to free drinks and canapes each night, and the rooms are larger also. We only had 2 minor problems - first being the courtesy bus seemed to miss picking us up both times that we arrived into Dubai airport, meaning we had to take a taxi. And secondly, it seems the 'scam' that previous readers had come across regarding mini-bar was also tried on us - but we point blank refused to pay for this charge, and it wasn't processed. Apart from that, I would recommend this hotel and we will stay here again when we return to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Dubai hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer38
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rydges Plaza for five nights and loved it. I liked the fact that it is so close to a residential area, the local shops were so much cheaper than the malls. I tried several of the restaurants and had fantastic meals every time. Room service and the buffet breakfasts were also way above what I expected. I found all the staff friendly and very helpful and the service became more personal after a few days. The pool was never busy, in fact there were never many people around, except in the restaurants. The laundry service was reasonably priced and so efficient I was tempted to do all my washing before leaving! The free internet was another bonus. It's not a hotel for those looking for luxury in Dubai, but you get what you pay for and if you want a small, friendly base where you can explore from it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghtraveller
Reviews.Content: Only an overnight stay at Rydges. The staff were very helpul and the room clean and comfortable. The hotel had a courtesy coach so we were able to be picked up from the airport and returend which saved a lot of hassle. Breakfast was very good and we also had dinner at the Italian resteraunt in the hotel which was excellent. A pool was available however beacase of a paucity of time we were not able to make use of it but for a longer stay it would be a welcome respite from the heat and traffic of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MegsNewZealand
Reviews.Content: My husband and my 1 year old daughter along with my brother -in-law and girlfrined stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in feb 07. I liked it and plan to return in Jan 08. I read the reviews on this web site before I booked it and even though there were some mixed reviews and i was abit nervous, i was very impressed with the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. There was always a taxi outside (Which are very cheap). We were on the executive floor and the large king size bed was bliss. I also liked the b'fast and being able to sit near the pool and have it was nice. The pool and spa were also a treat for us and having a few restaurants within the hotel also helped with travelling with an infant.

Reviews.Title: “bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: sonya.k
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a bit away from it all, opposite a roundabout,but no noise was heard. the free shuttle to the beach too ages,the beach was quite far and the return pick up took forever. we had to catch taxis everywhere,which did cost us alot. there is nothing near the hotel, nearest shopping centre is 10min taxi ride, and gets longer in traffic! the nice thing about the hotel is, there is a nice indian restaurant on the top floor, we ate there twice,and the swimming pool was ok. the breakfast was a bit boring,and the tours were expensive. wont stay here again as its too far from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Old and tired”
Reviews.Author: ukcas
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were immediately aware that this was not a 4 star hotel, which it claims to be. We refused the first two rooms offered as they smelt very damp, as if unused for a long time, the shower areas were dirty and the furnishings well past their sell by date. We were there for 3 nights and never saw the pool area tables receive so much as a cursory wipe with a cloth. On a positive note the staff were courteous and helpful but face an uphill battle with conditions as they are. However they did try the water scam referred to by a previous review.

Reviews.Title: “Would Return”
Reviews.Author: Boggertripper
Reviews.Content: Visited Dubai with my 19 year old daughter. No complaints at all. Pool was great. Great for visiting both old and new dubai. Spacious clean room, good choice at breakfast and staff were very helpful. Courtesy bus to beach. No problems getting taxi's which were very inexpensive. A good location. Had to get late flight back to Dublin, and managed to book room until the evening at half rate.

Reviews.Title: “magic”
Reviews.Author: oversixties
Reviews.Content: stayed with my wife for 5 days here. flew from glasgow with the rest of our family as they were returning home to sydney. stayed bed and breakfast restuarents in hotel great. for evening meal. booked tours through hotel 1 every day and good value for money and guides excellent. weather very hot. shopping ask reception to get you a taxi to a shopping mall about £2.00 they are massive and air condition also hotel has a bar

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: Kaypee00
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has seen better days but was functional. We were in transit to and from Australia from Scotland and the travel agent booked us into this hotel. It was a twenty minute journey from the airport and situated on a busy roundabout. The police and fire station are on the roundabout and they DO like to hear their sirens when they are going in and out of the station (all times night and day) The local mosque also broadcasts a call to prayer about 5.15 every morning. The staff were very friendly and gave us access to our room at 9am despite the booking saying we could not get access till 11am. The breakfast was a buffet style and more than adequate with a good choice of cold and cooked food. We ate in the hotel Italian style restaurant and in the St Andrews Bar where the food was good and relatively cheap. The hotel has an enclosed courtyard out the back with sun loungers, a small pool and a jacuzzi. In addition there is a well equipped fitness room. Not the hotel to spend a week or two at but certainly worth a couple of days stop over if you are in transit.

Reviews.Title: “cramped”
Reviews.Author: marcusEire
Reviews.Content: stayed here for the dubai world cup, staff very good , hotel not so good , three of us put in what can only be described as a single room, camp bed provided as third bed, moved to another room after complaining but this was not a lot better even really bad smell, charged for mini bar usage that had not taken place, would not return or advise anyone to

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: mother01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Rydges over Christmas excellent services, staff was very friendly and helpful.We had slight problems with our room which was speedily and efficiently resolved by the staff moving us to a suite. Will be booking again at Rydges for another holiday

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: PerthiteOZ
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. No problem with obtaining taxis but you must be aware of rush hour and complete lack thereof during this time - this has no bearing on the hotel. Buffet breakfast was adequate without being outstanding. Noisy location - heard prayer calls every morning from around 5.30am and could also hear running water from floor above that was being renovated. This is an old hotel that is clean and tidy but is in need of refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Fine - but no taxis”
Reviews.Author: BlackberryAddict
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't look that great from the outside, and inside it doesn't get much better, but it is adequate. My room was spacious was but very dark because the window was quite small. The hotel did not have internet access other than in the business centre which was annoying, but the restaurant/bars were okay and the pool was lovely for a late afternoon swim. The location depends on where you need to be, but it's quite close to the new World Trade Center - taxi availabilty was a bit of an issue though.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint lil hotel in the miccle of time”
Reviews.Author: Clivethegreat
Reviews.Content: A hotel between the old and new cities. It was nice to see both parts of dubai. Had we not stayed here we probably would not have experienced the true Dubai. SO glad we did. If you are one who is looking for all the luxeries and glad rags then this is not the place to stay, but if you are one who just likes experiencing new things and is not bothered by fakeness, thne do stay here, its a nice little hotel, the clientele are very mixed nationalities and overall was a pleasant stay. taxis are very very cheap so it did not matter - we could get to any point easily.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Disappointing Stay...!!”
Reviews.Author: lone.travel
Reviews.Content: I was in Dubai last January on Business and stayed in Rydges due to its proximity to my business location (Al Dhiyafa street). The hotel is an old one with 1980's worn out furniture. The bathroom fixtures are also rusty. The staff at the resturant and reception are very rude and would not rise to a level of one star hotel. The breakfast was the most misrable part of the stay. They served basically bread/butter/jam..!!! I had to get into an arguement with the heasd waiter just to get an omllette!! Another negative side is the lack of car parking space in front of the hotel. You may have to park your car at a good walking distance across the street. Housekeeping was also not impressive. I recall having left for over 10 hours and back to find the my room was not cleaned. I have stayed in many hotels in Dubai both 4 & 5 stars...but this is difinatly the WORST hotel in Dubai. Would not recommend it for any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to stay in this hotel by a colleague - and it was a good hotel . The dining options are very good and reasonably priced - the Chinese is very good , the Australian Bar is a good night out on ladies night. The pool is a little small - but I don't think you go to Dubai to sunbathe . The hotel forms an excellent base for shopping - taxis are so cheap that you can get any where

HotelInfo.Name: Rydges Plaza Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: Al Dhiyafa Street | Satwa Roundabout, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
